justification: “In this study, we introduce the group confidence judgment task, a novel approach for assessing communication success…” indicates the task itself is used as the instrument to measure successful communication/information exchange.

The authors list “1) individual stay/switch behavior” among the three outcome measures that “quantify the extent and nature of information exchange among participants, which we consider to be indicative of … successful communication.”
“Convergence was defined in two distinct ways… These measures quantify the extent and nature of information exchange among participants,” showing convergence is used to measure communication success.

measured_by: group’s voting strategy metric (confidence slating vs. majority voting)
justification: Outcome measure 3 is “the group's voting strategy,” and together with the others it is used to “quantify information exchange,” linking the voting-strategy metric to the construct.

During the task, “participants were instructed to … provide a confidence level, expressed as a percentage between 50% and 100%,” establishing the confidence rating scale as the instrument for assessing the construct of confidence.
